data.title: This Week in Geek History June 9 - June 15 | RPGG News
data.text:
Steve

United States

Michigan

I get it, I've been dismissed.

If you can't be part of the solution, it's time to ignore the problem.

June 9

68 - Emperor Nero commits suicide by having his secretary kill him

1672 - Peter the Great, Russian Tsar

1790 - 1st book copyrighted under US Constitution, "Philadelphia Spelling Book"

1915 - Les Paul, guitarist and inventor of the solid-body electric

1925 - American science fiction author Keith Laumer

1934 - Donald Duck's 'birth' via 'The Wise Little Hen'

1943 - American science fiction author Joe Haldeman

1963 - American actor Johnny Depp

1973 - Secretariat earns the Triple Crown by winning The Belmont Stakes by 31 lengths

1981 - American actess Natalie Portman

2013 - [d.] Iain Banks, 59 years old

June 10

323 b.C. - Alexander the Great dies either from fever or excessive wine @ 32 years old

1720 - Mrs. Clements of England markets first paste-style mustard

1793 - 1st public zoo opens in Paris

1845 - President Andrew Jackson's pet parrot is removed from Jackson's funeral for 'swearing so loud and long as to disturb the people [in the church]'

1895 - Hattie McDaniel (Gone with the Wind, Little Rascals). First African-American actress to win an Oscar

1910 - American bluesman/rock influencer Howlin' Wolf

1922 - American singer/actress Judy Garland

1928 - Children's author and illustrator Maurice Sendak

1981 - B3: Palace of the Silver Princess (Green) published

June 11

1184 b.C. - Troy is sacked and burned according to Eratosthenes

1770 - Captain James Cook discovers the Great Barrier Reef

1910 - Undersea explorer Jacques Cousteau

1913 - Football coach Vince Lombardi

1935 - American actor Gene Wilder

1936 - Robert E. Howard passes at 30

1956 - 4x Super Bowl winning QB & San Francisco 49er Joe Montana

1959 - English actor Hugh Laurie

1962 - The Anglin brothers and Frank Morris escape from Alcatraz (only ones to do so)

1969 - American actor Peter Dinklage

1987 - Margaret Thatcher wins third term as Prime Minister, ensuring punk rock will continue for a few more years

2009 - RPGGeek.com enters closed beta

June 12

1929 - Anne Frank. In 1942 she's given her diary as a birthday present

1931 - Al Capone indicted on 5,000 counts of prohibition and perjury

1932 - American author Rona Jaffe (Mazes and Monsters)

1981 - Raiders of the Lost Ark released

1987 - President Reagan challenges Gorbachev to 'tear down this wall'

June 13

40 - Agricola, Roman General & Governor of Britain

1865 - Irish poet and dramatist William Butler Yeats (my favorite poem EVER!)

1903 - Football player Harold "Red" Grange

1920 - US Post Office says children cannot not be sent by parcel post (after various instances)

1922 - Longest recorded attack of hiccups begins: Charlie Osborne gets the hiccups which continue for 68 years (1990!). He dies 11 months after they stop

1928 - John Nash, mathematician and game theorist, Nobel Laureate, incorrectly credited as inventor of Hex

1929 - Ralph McQuarrie, American artist/conceptual designer

1943 - English actor Malcolm McDowell

June 14

1933 - Polish-American author Jerzy Kosinski

1946 - US President Donald Trump

1949 - American author Harry Turtledove

1995 - Author Roger Zelazny passes at 60

June 15

1215 - King John signs the Magna Carta at Runnymede, England

1219 - Legend says the Dannebrog (flag of Denmark) fell from the sky during the Battle of Lindanise. It is the world's oldest national flag

1330 - Prince Edward of England, son of Edward III and known as the "Black Prince"

1843 - Norwegian composer Edvard Grieg

1914 - Romanian-American artist Saul Steinberg

1924 - J. Edgar Hoover assumes leadership of the FBI

1941 - American singer-songwriter Harry Nilsson

1954 - American actor Jim Belushi

I'm sure this list can be improved. Feel free to offer suggestions for this and upcoming weeks. If you want your birthday included just add it to this geeklist: RPG Geek Birthday List

[+] Dice rolls
